text: Currently, the differential diagnosis between atypical parkinsonisms and classical idiopathic Parkinson's disease can be quite difficult because of the significant overlap of clinical presentation and symptoms. Neurodegenerative conditions, including progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP), corticobasal degeneration (CBD), and frontotemporal dementia (FTD), are primarily characterized by accumulation of tau protein in the brain. Recent imaging developments for tau pathology may provide a promising tool for the assessment of diagnosis, prognosis, and progression of these neurodegenerative disorders. This review will survey PET studies to describe the recent advances in the imaging of tau pathology in PSP, CBD, and FTD.
title: New advances in tau imaging in parkinsonism.
